alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 1:14AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Craig, Rogers, northwestern Delaware, southeastern Osage, western Ottawa, northwestern Mayes, Washington, Nowata, southeastern Pawnee and northeastern Tulsa Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 114 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles east of South Coffeyville to 2 miles west of Talala to 2 miles northwest of Westport. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Bartlesville... Sand Springs... Claremore... Miami... Vinita... Baxter Springs... Nowata... Pawhuska... Owasso... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Hominy... Dewey... Cleveland... Commerce... Chelsea... Barnsdall... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 237 and 317. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Nowata; Osage; Ottawa; Pawnee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
